intro: Costus lateriflorus, commonly known as the false arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical structure of Costus lateriflorus is characterized by its aromatic, tubular flowers and robust underground stems.
